intro: Wahlenbergia orae, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Wahlenbergia orae is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
